p: Five invasive plant species were identified in the survey plots at PNR. Multiflora rose ( Rosa multiflora) and Japanese barberry ( Berberis thunbergii) were widespread in the reserve (accounting for 65% and 34% of all invasive species occurrences, respectively), while the three remaining species combined accounted for <1.5% of invasive species coverage ( Lonicera morrowi, Alliaria petiolata, and Celastrus orbiculatus, Fig 1). Only R. multiflora and B. thunbergii had sufficient sample sizes to be analyzed individually. All five invasive species were included for a third analysis assessing impacts of land-use history on the general occurrence of invasive species within PNR.
